page.title: 10WIGAN WASPS
page.content: Before Councillor T. Monks requested an{Olympic-size swimming pool}the baths were just a leisure place. 20 years ago building began and it was finished the following year at a cost of Â£840000. Haydn Rigby, team manager of the 1960 British Olympic Swimming Team, persuaded the council to appoint a full-time coach. He coached the team himself until{Keith Bewley}arrived. Since then the team has gone from strength to strength. Six members of the Wasps represented{Britain}in the {1984 Olympics}in Los Angeles: Nicholas Hodgson, Stephen Powlter, Ann Ogersby, Annabelle Crips, Gaynor Stanley and the bronze medal winner for 400 metres freestyle,{June Croft. Keith Bewley believes that the Wasps will grow from being the best club in Britain to the best in Europe.
